name: üìç Daily Nearby Garage Sales Alerts via Telegram

user.name: Thibaud
user.bio:
Automation consultant with over 10 years
experience helping Sales & Marketing teams to
streamline their processes.

description:
Get a personalized list of garage sales happening today, based on your current location, directly in Telegram each morning! This n8n workflow integrates Home Assistant and [Brocabrac.fr](Brocabrac.fr )to:
- Automatically detect your location every day
- Scrape and parse garage sale listings from Brocabrac
- Filter for high-quality and nearby events
- Send a neatly formatted message to your Telegram account

Perfect for treasure hunters and second-hand enthusiasts who want to stay in the loop with zero effort!

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

nodes.name: Filter on close and bigger events

parameters.content:
## 1Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch & Parse Garage Sale Data
### What happens:
- An HTTP request retrieves the HTML content of the Brocabrac page for the current location.
- The workflow extracts two pieces of data:
  - Date (the day events are listed for)
  - HTMLBlock (the full block of garage sales info)
- It checks if any events are scheduled for today.
- If yes, it extracts all div.ev entries representing individual garage sales.

### Purpose:
Converts a static webpage into structured data, ready for processing.

## 2Ô∏è‚É£ Process, Filter & Extract Relevant Events
What happens:
- Splits the list of garage sale entries and loops over each.
- From each block, it extracts:
  - City
  - Distance
  - Rank (event importance indicator using dots)
- Cleans up the data (e.g., removes "km" from distance, replaces "‚Ä¢" in rank).
- Filters events based on two criteria:
  - Distance ‚â§ 20 km
  - Rank must be present (indicating notable size or popularity)

Purpose:
Filters out irrelevant or too-distant events to surface only the best nearby options.

## 3Ô∏è‚É£ Format & Send Notifications via Telegram
### What happens:
- The remaining filtered events are formatted into a clean string like:
  ```
  City (Rank √† Distance km)
  ```
- These are combined into a single message like:
  ```
  üì¶üè° Voici les brocantes : - City1 (...) - City2 (...)
  ```
- The final message is sent to the user via Telegram.

### Purpose:
Delivers timely, relevant alerts about today‚Äôs garage sales in a user-friendly way.

## 0Ô∏è‚É£ Daily Trigger & Geolocation Setup
### What happens:
- The workflow is triggered either manually or automatically every day at 7 AM (Schedule Trigger node).
- It fetches the current location of a mobile phone using a Home Assistant sensor.
- It then builds a dynamic URL based on the user‚Äôs geolocation (postal code and locality) to query Brocabrac.fr for local garage sales.

### Purpose:
Ensures the data being fetched is location-aware and always relevant to the user's current position.

main.node: Filter on close and bigger events
